Description: The New York Attorney General announced that 15 large wine and liquor suppliers would pay a total of $2.3 million in fines and costs to resolve allegations that they engaged in illegal marketing practices that harmed smaller retailers, bars and restaurants. The announcement did not specify how the amount would be divided among the companies. Here we assume it was split evenly among them.

The New York Attorney General announced that 15 large wine and liquor suppliers would pay a total of $2.3 million in fines and costs to resolve allegations that they engaged in illegal marketing practices that harmed smaller retailers, bars and restaurants. The announcement did not specify how the amount would be divided among the companies. Here we assume it was split evenly among them.

Beam Suntory Inc., a company that produces and sells distilled beverages, agreed to pay a criminal monetary penalty of $19,572,885 to resolve the department's investigation into violations of the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act.

Info Source: Contained in data received from the agency on October 23, 2020 in response to an open records request.
